title: (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2023 (S.I. No. 14 of 2023), hereby
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Employment Permits
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Employment Permits 

(Amendment) (No. 3) Regulations 2023. 

(2) The collection citation “the Employment Permits Regulations 2017 to 

2023” includes these Regulations. 

Commencement
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited employment permit (amendment) (no 3) regulation 2023 (2) collection citation employment permit regulation 2017 2023 includes regulation commencement

title: (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2023 (S.I. No. 14 of 2023), hereby
heading: 2. Regulations 5, 6, 7, 9 and 10 come into operation on 17 January 2024.
text_raw:
2. Regulations 5, 6, 7, 9 and 10 come into operation on 17 January 2024. 

Definitions

title: (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2023 (S.I. No. 14 of 2023), hereby
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Regulations” means the Employment Permits Regulations 2017 (S.I 
No. 95 of 2017); 

“Regulations of 2022” means the Employment Permits (Amendment) (No. 3) 
Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 677 of 2022); 

“Regulations of 2023” means the Employment Permits (Amendment) (No. 2) 
Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 439 of 2023). 

Amendment of Regulation 3 of Principal Regulations
text_norm: 3 regulations-- principal regulation mean employment permit regulation 2017 (s.i no 95 2017) regulation 2022 mean employment permit (amendment) (no 3) regulation 2022 (s.i no 677 2022) regulation 2023 mean employment permit (amendment) (no 2) regulation 2023 (s.i no 439 2023) amendment regulation 3 principal regulation

title: (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2023 (S.I. No. 14 of 2023), hereby
heading: 4. Regulation 3 (as amended by Regulation 3 of the Regulations of 2022)
text_raw:
4. Regulation 3 (as amended by Regulation 3 of the Regulations of 2022) 
of the Principal Regulations is amended by substituting for the definition of 
“fast food outlet” the following: 

“‘fast food outlet’ means a type of quick service food establishment where 
precooked or quickly prepared food such as burgers, chips or pizzas is served, 
whether dine in, take at the counter to go, or drive through;”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 22nd December, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [680] 3 

Amendment of Regulation 18 of Principal Regulations

title: (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2023 (S.I. No. 14 of 2023), hereby
heading: 7. Regulation 29(1) (as amended by Regulation 6 of the Regulations of 2022)
text_raw:
7. Regulation 29(1) (as amended by Regulation 6 of the Regulations of 2022) 
of the Principal Regulations is amended by substituting for subparagraphs (a) 
to (h) the following: 

“(a) 

in the case of employment as— 

(i) 

a horticulture worker, 

(ii) 

a meat processor operative, 

(iii) a health care assistant, 

(iv) a care worker, or 

(v) 

a home carer, 

the minimum remuneration is €30,000 and in respect of which the 
minimum hourly rate of remuneration is €14.79, and 

(b) 

in any other case, the minimum annual remuneration is €34,000 
and in respect of which the minimum hourly rate of remuneration is 
€16.77.” 

Amendment of Regulation 30 of Principal Regulations
text_norm: 7 regulation 29(1) (as amended regulation 6 regulation 2022) principal regulation amended substituting subparagraphs (a) (h) following (a) case employment as-- (i) horticulture worker (ii) meat processor operative (iii) health care assistant (iv) care worker (v) home carer minimum remuneration eur30 000 respect minimum hourly rate remuneration eur14.79 (b) case minimum annual remuneration eur34 000 respect minimum hourly rate remuneration eur16.77 amendment regulation 30 principal regulation

title: (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2023 (S.I. No. 14 of 2023), hereby
heading: 30. The maximum number of General Employment Permits that
text_raw:
30. The maximum number of General Employment Permits that 
may be granted in respect of employment in the employments listed in 
the first column of the table in Schedule 7 is the corresponding number in 
the second column of that table and the period during which that 
maximum number shall be granted is the period from the corresponding 

 
 
 
 
 4 [680] 

date in the third column of that table until the maximum number is 
granted.”. 

Amendment of Regulation 36(1) of Principal Regulations

title: (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2023 (S.I. No. 14 of 2023), hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Employment Permits Regulations 2017 to 
provide for— 

- 

- 

- 

- 

a new definition of “fast food outlet”, 

new minimum annual remuneration and hourly rates of remuneration, 

new quotas for General Employment Permits in certain employments, 

introduce further quotas in certain employments, 

- 
changes to the list of employments in respect of which there is a 
shortage in respect of qualifications, experience or skills which are required for 
the proper functioning of the economy, and 

changes to the list of employments in respect of which an employment 

- 
permit shall not be granted. 

These Regulations may be cited as the Employment Permits (Amendment) 
(No. 3) Regulations 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [680] 31
